force_default_values_comment: You fucked up this json file and the changelog looks like dogshit? No worries, if you set this value to 'yes' parser will use _default_value values. You changed default values and you changelog still looks like dogshit? Use 'Lord Crisenpuer, I beg you to use default values' to force using the default values I hard-coded into parser's script
input_path_comment: Here you put path to your input changelog file ex. C:/absolute/path/to/changelog.txt ; relative/path/to/changelog.txt ; you can use / or \
output_path_comment: Here you put path to your output changelog file ex. C:/absolute/path/to/CHANGELOG.md ; CHANGELOG.md ; you can use / or \
version_range_comment: Versions that will be parsed, avalible options are: all, latest, X.X.X_X.X.X
version_header_style_comment: Version header style, check examples folder to see how different styles look. Avalible options are: title, subtitle, subsubtitle
date_header_style_comment: Date header style, check examples folder to see how different styles look. Avalible options are: sameline, subtitle, subsubtitle
changes_format_comment: Changes format style, check examples folder to see how different styles look. Avalible options are: subtitle-subsubtitle, subtitle-list, subsubtitle-list, list-sublist
